image.altText: Aurizon coal train generic shot

props.synopsis: Whyalla steelworks owner Sanjeev Gupta is facing another major challenge, with rail company Aurizon suspending some of its services for GFG Alliance over unpaid debts.

title.children: Rail operator Aurizon suspends services for GFG Alliance over unpaid debts

image.altText: a man in a business suit walks outside a court building

props.synopsis: A South Australian family says they forgive an Italian tourist whose "terrible error" caused a crash which killed three of their relatives in the state's Mid North last year, and say they do not believe he should be jailed.

title.children: Family forgives Italian tourist for 'serious lapse' which caused triple-fatal crash

image.altText: Adelaide United assistant coach Travis Dodd and defender Bailey O'Neil

props.synopsis: The current A-League Men's competition has less than a handful of Indigenous players, but emerging talent Bailey O'Neil and mentor Travis Dodd want to "get that ball rolling" when it comes to improving pathways.

title.children: Bailey O'Neil is one of just three Indigenous players in the A-League Men — he hopes to inspire more

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair wearing a pink and tan dress leans on a marble kitchen bench smiling and looking off camera.

props.synopsis: The cook was named Best Host of a TV Format Award at the C21 International Format Awards for the ABC show Maggie Beer's Big Mission, a project aiming to overhaul the aged care industry's dismal catering.

title.children: Maggie Beer wins international TV award, beating industry legends Jimmy Kimmel and Stephen Fry

image.altText: Workers using a reach truck to repair power lines at a tall electricity tower

props.synopsis: The tribunal overseeing energy prices in New South Wales is investigating whether power infrastructure company Transgrid failed to provide a reliable supply to residents in the far west after a second outage within a week.

title.children: Investigation launched, power back on after backup generator failed in Broken Hill

image.altText: Hainsworth interview

props.synopsis: Steven Hainsworth was arrested in 2019, 21 years after allegedly murdering the first of three victims. He has spent the past two months listening intently to evidence from the Supreme Court dock.

title.children: From arrest to trial, this is how the case of an accused serial killer unfolded

image.altText: Woman speaking into microphone outside parliament house.

props.synopsis: University of Adelaide law academic Joanna Howe has posted to social media labelling female politicians 'baby killers' following a failure to change South Australian abortion laws.

title.children: Anti-abortion activist brands female politicians 'baby killers' in social media post

image.altText: A 15-year-old girl sitting on a couch and looking at her phone.

props.synopsis: The federal government's proposed social media ban is likely to be detrimental to some teens, particularly for young people in isolated and marginalised communities, experts and teenagers say.

title.children: Why the proposed social media ban could do more harm than good

image.altText: A brown snake rearing up with it's mouth open, on red grassy soil.

props.synopsis: A toxicologist warns it's never safe to assume a snake bite is free of venom, after a South Australian man experiences a delayed reaction to poison from a suspected brown snake bite.

title.children: Snake bite victim's 'unusual' 15-hour wait before venom kicks in

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and glasses looks ahead

props.synopsis: The head of GFG Alliance Sanjeev Gupta says there will be no more job losses at the Whyalla steelworks, while not being able to give a firm timeline on when he expects the blast furnace to come online again.

title.children: Whyalla steelworks owner promises no more job cuts with blast furnace to be fixed in 'days or weeks'

image.altText: A large grey missile flies over two multi-storey residential buildings.

props.synopsis: An Associated Press photographer captures a rare glimpse of what appears to be a powerful Israeli smart bomb mid-air, before it flattened a multi-storey building in a neighbourhood in southern Beirut.

title.children: Photos of Beirut air strike capture rare glimpse of powerful Israeli missile mid-air

image.altText: Lidia Thorpe marches through a crowd of people wearing a possum skin cloak.

props.synopsis: Just 40 minutes were set aside for a parliamentary reception for the royals, but independent senator Lidia Thorpe only needed one of those minutes to make international headlines.

title.children: The big republic debate that wasn't — what the international media got wrong

image.altText: Lidia Thorpe swearing in

props.synopsis: The Senator joked on Wednesday she had sworn allegiance to the Queen's "hairs" not her "heirs" but now says that was not intentional.

title.children: Thorpe revises comments about oath, now saying she 'misspoke' owing to grammatical error

image.altText: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump looking at each other in election illustration

props.synopsis: Officials are fighting a resurgence in conspiracy theories as Donald Trump's campaign accuses the UK Labour Party of election interference — here's the latest updates from the US election.

title.children: Conspiracy theories and Donald Trump's complaint against the UK Labour Party — the latest from the US election campaign trail

image.altText: Smoke rises from the headquarters of Turkey's aviation company TUSAS

props.synopsis: The Turkish defence ministry said more than 30 targets were 'destroyed' in an aerial offensive after an earlier attack at aerospace company TUSAS.

title.children: Türkiye hits more than 30 militant targets after attack in Ankara

image.altText: An illustration of a shadowy figure in the distance with the Israeli flag in the front

props.synopsis: Models, businessmen and even former politicians have been picked up by Israeli intelligence agencies after allegedly working for Iran.

title.children: Israelis are being recruited by Iran for espionage operations. Now, they're being caught

image.altText: a picture of a river bordered by trees looking towards the horizon on a clear day.

props.synopsis: A nomination for critically endangered conservation status for the Lower Murray is a step too far, say some in South Australia, while others insist it's needed to ensure the river's health.

title.children: Murray mighty or critically endangered? Strong reactions to conservation status proposal

image.altText: A man leaving a courthouse followed by a camera

props.synopsis: A Melbourne magistrate said 25-year-old Nazir Haddara was entitled to the presumption of innocence after the alleged tobacco kingpin was arrested on Monday following a police operation.

title.children: Alleged crime boss embroiled in Melbourne tobacco wars freed on bail despite 'significant risk' to public

image.altText: A man with a mic

props.synopsis: Brisbane's lord mayor refuses to return power to two homeless camps and vows to crack down even harder on "anti-social behaviour" at the tent cities.

title.children: Mayor refuses to return power to homeless camps after cutting electricity and barbecues

image.altText: A woman with shoulder length brown hair wearing a printed blue top

props.synopsis: Gisele Pelicot, the alleged victim of rape by dozens of men in France, tells a court she is determined making her case public should help bring change in society.

title.children: 'This is not just my battle': Gisele Pelicot gives first testimony in France mass rape trial

image.altText: A fireball and smoke erupt from a block of apartment buildings at night in a terrifying scene

props.synopsis: The Qatari media network called the Israeli claims against six of its Palestinian journalists an attempt to "silence" their reporting on the war.

title.children: Israel strikes Beirut as Al Jazeera rejects claims of journalists working for Hamas

image.altText: A woman holds a sign at a Brisbane pro-choice rally in May.

props.synopsis: Meanwhile research published by the Society of Family Planning has found abortion rates have stayed the same overall, despite an outright ban in some states.

title.children: Infant mortality increases by 7 per cent in the US following removal of abortion as constitutional right

image.altText: A man stands on the bitumen with outback landscape behind him with a cowboy hat

props.synopsis: With the abortion debate making Queensland's election campaign national news, many Australians might be thinking 'cowboy' is a label applying to more than just supporters of the NRL team, writes Matt Eaton.

title.children: The beliefs of a man in a hat could have coloured how many Australians view life in Queensland

image.altText: People stand on metal roof during flooding

props.synopsis: Most of the deaths were reported in the Bicol region, south-east of Manila, where at least 20 people died, including seven residents in Naga city.

title.children: At least 24 people dead as tropical storm triggers flooding and landslides in Philippines

props.synopsis: A suspect in a public shooting in Western Sydney is believed also to be the same person caught setting themselves alight in an attempt to burn a car a short distance away.

title.children: Suspected gunman accidentally sets self on fire in attempt to destroy getaway car following public shooting

image.altText: a woman sitting in a doctor office, she has short blonde hair, a pink singlet on

props.synopsis: A 40 per cent drop in patient numbers over 10 years means Gosford Private Hospital will end birth services in March, leaving a public facility in Gosford as the only birthing hospital available in the region.

title.children: Steep decline in patient numbers blamed as another private maternity ward closes

image.altText: A group people with a sign reading "white man fight back" near a stone cenotaph.

props.synopsis: There are deep concerns about "neo-Nazi, fascist idiots" in a NSW border town after residents found white supremacist material in their letterboxes.

title.children: Corowa residents disgusted by white supremacist flyer drop after neo-Nazi rally

image.altText: A woman stands next to a painting in a gallery that has been spray painted with the Woodside logo.

props.synopsis: The WA Museum is criticised after acquiring a piece of perspex protecting an iconic Australian painting which was graffitied by climate activists.

title.children: WA Museum under fire for acquiring perspex cover on famous Frederick McCubbin painting defaced by climate protesters

image.altText: A girl with long red hair stands in a snowy field

props.synopsis: Scarlett Jenkinson and Eddie Ratcliffe, both 15 at the time, were found guilty of Brianna's murder in December 2023 and have been sentenced to life in prison.

title.children: Brianna Ghey's mother 'knew something like this was going to happen', inquest into murder hears

image.altText: An artist's impression of a black hole drawing material off a nearby star. A second star is in the background.

props.synopsis: A system called V404 Cygni was thought to be a black hole and a companion star, but another star billions of kilometres away was also found gravitationally connected to the duo.

title.children: First 'black hole triple system' discovered by astronomers

image.altText: a shark underwater

props.synopsis: Three shark warning towers on the state's remote south coast need urgent replacement — including one that's completely offline — but there's confusion over who should foot the bill.

title.children: Shark warning tower installed after WA diver's death offline as summer looms

image.altText: A husband looks down at his wife who stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: Thai migrant Paphatsiri "Net" Woolcock has lived in a remote WA mining town for almost a decade and has two children, but has failed the test five times.

title.children: Australia's updated citizenship test is proving too hard for many — Net has failed it five times

image.altText: Light beams from a twisting silver sculpture with a wide opening outside an art gallery at night.

props.synopsis: Lindy Lee's sculpture Ouroboros, based on the ancient tale of the same name about a snake swallowing its own tail, is the National Gallery of Australia's largest ever investment in a single artwork.

title.children: $14 million, 13 tonne sculpture symbolising the endless cycle of birth and death unveiled at National Gallery of Australia
